Noah Star

Presidential Candidate

Meet Noah

Originally from Lexington, Massachusetts, Noah Star is a junior Political Science and History major at Northwestern University. Noah chose Northwestern because of our beautiful campus, Big Ten sports, and Northwestern’s strong Political Science and History programs. Noah’s first attempt at ASG ended in rejection, as he was not selected to be the Willard RCB Senator. Now, Noah is the Speaker of the Senate. As Speaker, Noah has helped push for direct elections of residential and off-campus Senators, making the Senate a more accessible space for students, and widening the lens of the Senate’s legislative focus. He won a Winter Campus Life Award for his work planning and leading the Senate during last quarter’s debate about divestment from six corporations working with Israel.

Noah has also been Vice President of his fraternity, a Peer Adviser, a member of J Street Northwestern, and a member of Mayfest. His favorite book is Empire Falls by Richard Russo and his favorite bands are Radiohead, the National, and Grizzly Bear.

Christina Kim

Vice-Presidential
Candidate

Meet Christina

Born only 6 miles from Northwestern, Christina Kim now lives 719 miles away in northern Virginia. Christina started coding at the age of 15 and continues to hack as a computer science major at Northwestern. Christina chose to Go ‘Cats to return to her roots, eat more hot dogs, enjoy Lake Michigan, and take DTC. She got her first exposure to ASG through the President’s Leadership Initiative Committee her freshman year and is now the Vice President of Services. As VP of Services, Christina orchestrated Northwestern’s first Hackathon, created CourseDJ, and produced the Study Abroad Guide. Currently, ASG Services is building an app that tackles over-programming through determining conflicting peak times as well as a website for students and student groups that connects them to relevant civic engagement and volunteering opportunities.

In addition to her leadership within ASG, Christina is an undergraduate researcher at Northwestern’s Delta Lab and served as a Publicity Co-chair for Northwestern University’s Conference on Human Rights. She is a Quest Scholar and a GESI South Africa alum. She enjoys being near bodies of water, looking at instagrams of puppies, and good food.
